intro: Loxocarpus verbeniflos, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy white to yellow flowers. The plant has a compact, rounded shape with small, leathery leaves that give it a distinctive silvery appearance. It produces small, round fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Loxocarpus verbeniflos is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
